Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Friday December 20), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, december 20th. 

microsoft is ramping up its ai investments with plans to integrate chatgpt into its office suite by the end of next year. this move comes after the tech giant's recent multibillion-dollar investment in openai, the creators of chatgpt. microsoft aims to leverage ai capabilities to enhance productivity tools like word, excel, and outlook, fundamentally changing how users interact with software.

meanwhile, meta, the parent company of facebook, is pulling back on its metaverse investments amid rising costs and lower-than-expected user engagement. ceo mark zuckerberg hinted at a strategic pivot, suggesting more focus on ai-driven services for existing platforms. the announcement follows ongoing scrutiny about meta’s metaverse ambitions and their real-world applicability.

over in the electric vehicle sphere, rivian is facing another production setback, causing shares to plummet by 15%. the ev maker cited supply chain disruptions as the primary culprit. rivian's struggles reflect broader challenges in the auto industry, as manufacturers grapple with chip shortages and logistic bottlenecks.

lastly, netflix is shaking up the streaming landscape yet again, with plans to enter the live sports arena. the streaming giant is reportedly in talks to acquire rights for several major league sports, aiming to capture a slice of the lucrative live sports market currently dominated by traditional broadcasters.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, december 20th.

microsoft is taking a big leap forward in ai by integrating chatgpt into its office suite by the end of next year. this initiative follows the company's recent multibillion-dollar investment in openai, the creators of chatgpt. the tech giant aims to transform its productivity tools like word, excel, and outlook, fundamentally altering how users engage with software.

in other news, meta, the parent company of facebook, is dialing back its metaverse investments due to rising costs and lower-than-expected user engagement. ceo mark zuckerberg hinted at a strategic pivot toward ai-driven services on existing platforms. this shift comes amidst growing questions about the practicality of meta's metaverse goals.

over in the electric vehicle sector, rivian is experiencing another production setback leading to a 15% drop in shares. the ev maker attributes this stumble to supply chain disruptions. rivian's challenges mirror the broader difficulties faced by the auto industry, which continues to battle chip shortages and logistical woes.

lastly, netflix is poised to disrupt the streaming landscape once more by eyeing a move into live sports. the streaming powerhouse is reportedly negotiating rights for several major league sports, aiming to carve out a share of the lucrative live sports market that traditional broadcasters currently rule.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-177 Microsoft's Chatgpt Integration in Office Suite 🖥️, Meta's Metaverse Pivot 🔄, Rivian's Ev Production Woes 🚙
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, december 20th. dive into the latest tech developments:

  • microsoft embraces ai: integrating chatgpt into the office suite by end of next year, transforming productivity tools like word, excel, and outlook.
  • meta's strategic pivot: cutting back on metaverse investments, shifting focus towards ai-driven services due to cost concerns and lower user engagement.
  • rivian's production woes: experiencing setbacks linked to supply chain disruptions, resulting in a 15% drop in shares amid broader industry challenges.
  • netflix explores live sports: negotiating rights for major league sports, potentially revolutionizing the streaming landscape by entering the live sports arena.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow!
Image Prompt: a unified podcast cover image set in a futuristic digital landscape. in the center, a cutting-edge office scene with a transparent holographic computer display features an animated ai assistant, symbolizing microsoft's chatgpt integration, interacting effortlessly with a user. to the left, the digital environment transforms into a vibrant, immersive metaverse scene, showcasing meta's pivot, with avatars and interconnected virtual worlds swirling seamlessly in 3d. to the right, a dynamic electric vehicle assembly line is shown, with robots and engineers collaboratively working on a sleek, partially constructed rivian truck, highlighting the ev production challenges. the elements blend together with electric blue and green hues, forming a cohesive vision of technological evolution and integration
